DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: ROSSI, J. L. O.;Rossi J.L.;ROSSI, J.L.;Rossi, Joao Luis

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Engenheiro Eletricista e de Projetos com experincia em pesquisa e desenvolvimento em sistemas de energia renovvel, projeto e execuo eltrica de obras prediais, infraestrutura para telecomunicaes (subestaes, quadros de distribuio e controle e aterramentos) e sistemas de rastreamento Solar para Usinas Fotovoltaicas.
Entre 2014 e 2017 em Roma - Itlia, realizou pesquisas e desenvolvimento de ferramentas para incentivar a utilizao de fontes de energia renovveis, apoiado por testes fsicos (SmartGrids, Fotovoltaicos, Banco de Baterias, Clulas Combustvel, GMGs, Automao e Anlise do sistema eltrico).
Entre 2005 a 2013, Engenheiro Eletricista e Responsvel Tcnico (RT) na construo de 4 edifcios residenciais e um conjunto habitacional com 200 casas populares em Anpolis/GO - Brasil, atuou efetivamente, sendo o responsvel tcnico, na reestruturao das instalaes eltricas dos centros de comunicao estaduais da TELEFNICA / VIVO no Nordeste Brasileiro, executou instalao e manuteno em campo de equipamentos industriais (Grupo-Moto- Geradores / GMGs e Chillers em Treviso - Itlia) e foi o responsvel, como eletricista/eletrotcnico em diversas obras de instalaes eltricas prediais (residenciais, comerciais e industriais) em Londres / Inglaterra.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Electrical and Project Engineer with experience in research and development in renewable energy systems, design and execution of electrical building works, infrastructure for telecommunications (substations, distribution and control panels and grounding) and Tracking System for Solar Plants.
- 2014 o 2017 in Rome - Italy, it carried out research and development of tools to encourage the use of renewable energy sources, supported by physical tests (SmartGrids, Photovoltaics, Battery Bank, Fuel Cells, GMGs, Automation and Analysis of the electrical system) .
- 2005 to 2013, Electrical Engineer and Technical Responsible (RT) in the construction of 4 residential buildings and a housing complex with 200 popular houses in Anpolis / GO - Brazil, in charge of the restructuring of the electrical installations of the state communications centers of TELEFNICA / VIVO in the Brazilian Northeast, performed the installation and maintenance in the field of industrial equipment (Group-Generators / GMGs and Chillers in Treviso - Italy) and was responsible, as an electrician / electrician in various electrical building works (residential, commercial and industrial) in London / England.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Engenheiro Eletricista e Responsvel tcnico a nvel nacional de obras prediais e infra-extrutra para sistema de telefonia celular. Responsvel por Projetos eltricos, especificao de materiais, acompanhamento, suporte, superviso tcnica de obras prediais e contratao de terceiros.
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Electrical Engineer and Technical Responsible at national level of building and infra-structure works for cellular telephone system. Responsible for Electrical projects, specification of materials, monitoring, support, technical supervision of building works and contracting of third parties.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Supervisor Tcnico para o departamento de assistncia tcnica em campo e tcnico de manuteno para equipamentos industriais destinados a codificao de produtos.
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Technical Supervisor for the department of technical and field service technician for equipment intended for industrial coding products.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Realizao de Projetos e Execuo de Instalaes eltricas prediais e comerciais em Londres / Inglaterra.
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Design and Implementation of Building residential electrical installations. In London / England.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Instalao e Manuteno de Grupo Moto-Geradores para COGERAO de energia eltrica e Sistemas de TRIGERAO Energtica por Absoro (sistemas de baixo consumo de energia eltrica que utilizam a energia da gua quente residual do Grupo Moto-Gerador para gerar potncia fria).
Servios realizados em Treviso / Itlia
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Installation and Maintenance of Moto-generators set, for electrical power energy and trigeneration systems by Absorption (Chiller by Absorption). In Treviso / Italy

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Otimizao das fontes renovveis quando conectadas a rede eltrica.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Otimizao da carga eltrica residencial, quando associadas a fontes de energia renovveis e conectadas rede eltrica.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Optimization of residential consumption, when associated with small renewable sources and connected to electrical main grid.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Utilizao do algoritmo MPC para predio da carga eltrica e clima.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Utilizao de um algoritmo MPC/MILP para a predio da carga eltrica residencial, radiao solar e temperatura ambiente, visando a otimizao do consumo eltrico residencial e possibilitando o aumento da penetrao de sistemas renovveis na rede eltrica local e com isso reduzindo o consumo de energias fosseis.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Utilization of an MPC / MILP algorithm for the prediction of residential electric charge, solar radiation and ambient temperature, aiming at the optimization of residential electrical consumption and allowing the increase of penetration of renewable systems in the local power grid and thereby reducing the consumption of fossil energies .
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: MPC algorithm to predict the Electric Load and Weather

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Elaborao de Projetos, documentao tcnica, acompanhamento de obra e responsvel pelo comissionamento de sistemas de rastreamento solar (Tracker).
UFV So Pedro II e IV - 56 MWp em Bom Jesus da Lapa / BA - Brasil (06/2018 a 09/2018) UFV Verde Vale III - 17 MWp em Guanambia / BA - Brasil (08/2018) UFV Juazeiro i, II, III e IV - 130 MWp em Juazeiro / BA - Brasil (10/2018 a 03/2019) UFV Cafayate - 100 MWp em Cafayate / Salta - Argentina (11/2018 a 08/2019) UFV Ullum e SolarGen - 30 MWp em Ullum / San Juan - Argentina (11/2018 a 08/2019)
No periodo de 12/2018 a 03/2019, acompanhei junto ao departamento de Engenharia, Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento da Convert Itlia, situada nas cidades de Roma e Pomezia (Itlia), o desenvolvimento de um sistema de rastreamento solar auto-alimentado (Tracker Self-Powered), com a finalidade de utilizao em usinas solares para a gerao distribuda (GD).

AREA-DE-ATUACAO.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Anlise de Impactos Produzidos por Sistemas Energticos
Medio, Controle, Correo e Proteo de Sistemas Eltricos de Potncia

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Grid-connected Microgrids to Support Renewable Energy Sources Penetration
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Grid-connected Microgrids to Support Renewable Energy Sources Penetration

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Distributed generation systems and microgrids are instrumental for a greater penetration of renewables to achieve a substantial reduction on carbon emissions. However, microgrids performances and reliability strongly depend on the continuous interaction between power generation, storage and load requirements, highlighting the importance in developing a proper energy management strategy and the relative control system. In this work a Model predictive Control (MPC) strategy, based on a Mixed Linear Integer Programming framework, has been applied to a residential microgrid case. Theoretical results obtained confirm that grid connected microgrids have potential capabilities in grid balancing allowing for a larger penetration of fluctuating renewable energy sources and thus producing economic benefits for both end-user and grid operators. A microgrid test bench to reproduce previous microgrid model is also presented in the paper. The experimental setup has been used to validate results obtained from simulation. Results obtained confirm the potential of this solution and its real applicability.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Hybrid renewable energy systems for renewable integration in microgrids: Influence of sizing on performance
Hybrid renewable energy systems for household ancillary services

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ELECTRICAL POWER & ENERGY SYSTEMS

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Renewable source penetration and microgrids: Effects of MILP - Based control strategies
Renewable sources integration through the optimization of the load for residential applications.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Teste do comportamento da carga residencial a longo prazo
DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.AMBIENTE: Ferramenta de apoio|Simulao e modelaem|Aplicativos desenvolv. sist. de acordo com determ. metodologia
DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.INSTITUICAO-FINANCIADORA: CAPES - Coordenadoria para aperfeioamento de pessoal de nvel superior.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Modelo criado em MatLAB e SIMULINK para agilizar a simulao do comportamento de uma carga eltrica residencial (dirio a anual), composto por fonte de energia renovvel programvel e no programvel: Clula Combustvel (PEM-FC) e Fotovoltaico, estocagem de energia de curto e longo prazo: Bateria e Eletrolizador, conexo a rede eltrica local de baixa tenso, barramento para conexo dos elementos em Corrente Contnua (CC) e sistema de gerenciamento baseado em: nos sistema inteligentes de gerenciamento da energia MPC (Metodo preditivo de controle associado a um algoritmo MILP - Programao linear de Inteiros mistos), RBC (Controle baseado em regras) e STD (Modelo de gesto standard, sem gerenciamento inteligente da energia) e bloco de medio.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Model created in MatLAB and SIMULINK to streamline the simulation of the behavior of a residential electrical charge (daily to annual), composed of renewable and programmable renewable energy source: Fuel Cell (PEM-FC) and Photovoltaic, Short and long term energy storage: Battery and Electrolyzer, Connection to local low voltage grid, DC-Bus to connecting Microgrid Elements and management system based on: intelligent energy management systems MPC (Predictive control method associated with a MILP algorithm - Mixed-Integer Linear Programming), RBC (Rule Based Control) and STD (Standard Management Model, without intelligent energy management) and measurement block.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Grid-Connected Microgrids to Support Renewable Energy Sources Penetration
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Grid-Connected Microgrids to Support Renewable Energy Sources Penetration

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ICAE 2016 - International Conference on Applied Energy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Distributed generation systems and microgrids are instrumental for a greater penetration of renewables to achieve a substantial reduction on carbon emissions. However, microgrids performances and reliability strongly depend on the continuous interaction between power generation, storage and load requirements, highlighting the importance in developing a proper energy management strategy and the relative control system. In this work a Model predictive Control (MPC) strategy, based on a Mixed Linear Integer Programming framework, has been applied to a residential microgrid case. Theoretical results obtained confirm that grid connected microgrids have potential capabilities in grid balancing allowing for a larger penetration of fluctuating renewable energy sources and thus producing economic benefits for both end-user and grid operators. A microgrid test bench to reproduce previous microgrid model is also presented in the paper. The experimental setup has been used to validate results obtained from simulation. Results obtained confirm the potential of this solution and its real applicability.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Penetration of renewable sources in microgrids: effects of MILP ? based control strategies
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Penetration of renewable sources in microgrids: effects of MILP ? based control strategies

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 10th International Conference on Sustainable Energy & Environmental Protection

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The renewable source power capacity installed has significantly increased in the last five years thanks to strong policy support and sharp cost reduction of equipment. This rapid growth of the Distributed Generation (DG) concept has given technical issues regarding the integration and control within the grid nodes, depending on the system characteristics and on the architecture of the local grid infrastructure. A predictive control strategy integrating renewable and non-renewable sources as well as energy storage within the grid, is a potential solution to face with the mentioned issues, serving as ancillary services to the grid. Focusing on the residential energy demand, the behavior of a smart building of 30 apartments has been considered in this work. The HRS (Hybrid Renewable System) has been controlled by a Model Predictive Control (MPC) strategy, based on the Mixed Integer Linear Programming (MILP) approach. The HRS includes sub-systems for the conversion of renewable energy sources (photovoltaic and wind power plants) as well as non-renewable ones (thermoelectric and turbo-gas plants) available at the connection with the main grid. Several scenarios have been tested under different weather conditions (winter and summer) and in terms of renewable sources penetration (low, medium and high scenarios). Results obtained with the MPC/MILP control strategy have been compared with a Rule Based Control (RBC) approach both from an energy and economic standpoints. Results show that the use of MPC improves the integration of the residential microgrid with the renewable sources connected to the grid thanks to the predictive system smoothing out the energy demand profile, matching with the local production and in this way absorbing the peak production from the photovoltaic and wind farms, even in the cases of higher penetration. The cost of domestic demand controlled by the MILP presents even more advantages whenever the "Peak Demand Pricing" is employed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The renewable source power capacity installed has significantly increased in the last five years thanks to strong policy support and sharp cost reduction of equipment. This rapid growth of the Distributed Generation (DG) concept has given technical issues regarding the integration and control within the grid nodes, depending on the system characteristics and on the architecture of the local grid infrastructure. A predictive control strategy integrating renewable and non-renewable sources as well as energy storage within the grid, is a potential solution to face with the mentioned issues, serving as ancillary services to the grid. Focusing on the residential energy demand, the behavior of a smart building of 30 apartments has been considered in this work. The HRS (Hybrid Renewable System) has been controlled by a Model Predictive Control (MPC) strategy, based on the Mixed Integer Linear Programming (MILP) approach. The HRS includes sub-systems for the conversion of renewable energy sources (photovoltaic and wind power plants) as well as non-renewable ones (thermoelectric and turbo-gas plants) available at the connection with the main grid. Several scenarios have been tested under different weather conditions (winter and summer) and in terms of renewable sources penetration (low, medium and high scenarios). Results obtained with the MPC/MILP control strategy have been compared with a Rule Based Control (RBC) approach both from an energy and economic standpoints. Results show that the use of MPC improves the integration of the residential microgrid with the renewable sources connected to the grid thanks to the predictive system smoothing out the energy demand profile, matching with the local production and in this way absorbing the peak production from the photovoltaic and wind farms, even in the cases of higher penetration. The cost of domestic demand controlled by the MILP presents even more advantages whenever the "Peak Demand Pricing" is employed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Hybrid Renewable Systems for Microgrids: influence of system sizing on performances.
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Hybrid Renewable Systems for Microgrids: influence of system sizing on performances.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: SEEP 2017 - 10th International Conference on Sustainable Energy & Environmental Protection

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the last years, several works have been presented on the study of the Hybrid Power System (HPSs) as effective means of increasing the exploitation of local renewable energy sources in the Distributed Generation (DG) paradigm context. Several studies have been focusing on the system efficiency point of view, on the economic or on the environmental impact. This work aims at thoroughly analyzing the mentioned effects for two different energy demand profiles: an industrial facility and a residential complex of 75 apartments with similar energy requests over the year. A parametric analysis with different components sizing was done to evaluate the optimal solution in terms of deployment of renewable energy, resilience of the system and environmental impact, considering the economic convenience as a feasibility constraint. The economic impact on the Electric Main Grid (EG) was evaluated taking into account interruption, cycling, reserve, curtailment and unbalancing costs, depending on renewable energy sources (RES) penetration, with the last one partially considered as incentive. Results show that the two main drivers for the convenience of such systems are the load profile and the PV power plant size. The former shows higher effectiveness of the MG management for the residential load rather than the industrial one, due to the scheduling possibility of the demand during the peak-hours with a remarkable and positive effect on the EG. The latter shows that the right sizing of the PV plant is a better economic solution thanks to a smarter use of the battery and to a lower dependence on the energy exchanged with the EG.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In the last years, several works have been presented on the study of the Hybrid Power System (HPSs) as effective means of increasing the exploitation of local renewable energy sources in the Distributed Generation (DG) paradigm context. Several studies have been focusing on the system efficiency point of view, on the economic or on the environmental impact. This work aims at thoroughly analyzing the mentioned effects for two different energy demand profiles: an industrial facility and a residential complex of 75 apartments with similar energy requests over the year. A parametric analysis with different components sizing was done to evaluate the optimal solution in terms of deployment of renewable energy, resilience of the system and environmental impact, considering the economic convenience as a feasibility constraint. The economic impact on the Electric Main Grid (EG) was evaluated taking into account interruption, cycling, reserve, curtailment and unbalancing costs, depending on renewable energy sources (RES) penetration, with the last one partially considered as incentive. Results show that the two main drivers for the convenience of such systems are the load profile and the PV power plant size. The former shows higher effectiveness of the MG management for the residential load rather than the industrial one, due to the scheduling possibility of the demand during the peak-hours with a remarkable and positive effect on the EG. The latter shows that the right sizing of the PV plant is a better economic solution thanks to a smarter use of the battery and to a lower dependence on the energy exchanged with the EG.
